source_id: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_002_chunk1
evidence_span: During the early years of atomic power development there was a reliance on conventional materials, for example, stainless steels, for core structural components.

source_id: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_002_chunk1
evidence_span: One of these elements, zirconium, showed great potential although relatively little was known about its properties.

source_id: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_002_chunk1
evidence_span: During the 1940's and 1950's the U.S. Navy reactor program and the U.S. Bureau of Mines developed reduction processes and investigated zirconium alloys with acceptable properties, especially good corrosion resistance.
